title: Closure needing type annotation in const scope causes ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Probably somewhat related to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/52432
This ICE's on stable, beta and nightly:

```Rust
fn main() {
    [(); &(&'static: loop { |x| {}; }) as *const _ as usize]
}
```

Playground: https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=e1a6d6ef161b5cacb9ef406251807c3c&version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2015
Backtrace:
```
error: invalid label name `'static`
   --> src\lib.rs:159:17
    |
159 |         [(); &(&'static: loop { |x| {}; }) as *const _ as usize]
    |                 ^^^^^^^

warning: unreachable expression
   --> src\lib.rs:159:15
    |
159 |         [(); &(&'static: loop { |x| {}; }) as *const _ as usize]
    |               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: #[warn(unreachable_code)] on by default

error: internal compiler error: librustc_mir\hair\cx\expr.rs:478: closure expr w/o closure type: [type error]
   --> src\lib.rs:159:33
    |
159 |         [(); &(&'static: loop { |x| {}; }) as *const _ as usize]
    |                                 ^^^^^^

thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors\lib.rs:499:9
stack backtrace:

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.29.0-nightly (31f1bc7b4 2018-07-15) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib
```
